20namespace v8 {
21namespace internal {

23class FreeListCategory;
24class Space;
25
26// MutablePageMetadata represents a memory region owned by a specific space.
27// It is divided into the header and the body. Chunk start is always
28// 1MB aligned. Start of the body is aligned so it can accommodate
29// any heap object.
30class MutablePageMetadata : public MemoryChunkMetadata {
31 public:
32 // |kDone|: The page state when sweeping is complete or sweeping must not be
33 // performed on that page. Sweeper threads that are done with their work
34 // will set this value and not touch the page anymore.
35 // |kPending|: This page is ready for parallel sweeping.
36 // |kInProgress|: This page is currently swept by a sweeper thread.
37 enum class ConcurrentSweepingState : intptr_t {
38 kDone,
39 kPending,
40 kInProgress,
41 };
42
43 static const size_t kHeaderSize = MemoryChunkLayout::kMemoryChunkHeaderSize;
44
45 static const intptr_t kOldToNewSlotSetOffset =
46 MemoryChunkLayout::kSlotSetOffset;
47
48 // Page size in bytes. This must be a multiple of the OS page size.
49 static const int kPageSize = kRegularPageSize;
50
51 MutablePageMetadata(Heap* heap, BaseSpace* space, size_t size,
52 Address area_start, Address area_end,
53 VirtualMemory reservation, PageSize page_size);
54
55 MemoryChunk::MainThreadFlags InitialFlags(Executability executable) const;
56
57 // Only works if the pointer is in the first kPageSize of the MemoryChunk.
58 V8_INLINE static MutablePageMetadata* FromAddress(Address a);
59
60 // Only works if the object is in the first kPageSize of the MemoryChunk.
61 V8_INLINE static MutablePageMetadata* FromHeapObject(Tagged<HeapObject> o);
62
63 static MutablePageMetadata* cast(MemoryChunkMetadata* metadata) {
64 SLOW_DCHECK(!metadata || !metadata->Chunk()->InReadOnlySpace());
65 return static_cast<MutablePageMetadata*>(metadata);
66 }
67
68 static const MutablePageMetadata* cast(const MemoryChunkMetadata* metadata) {
69 SLOW_DCHECK(!metadata->Chunk()->InReadOnlySpace());
70 return static_cast<const MutablePageMetadata*>(metadata);
71 }
72
73 size_t buckets() const { return SlotSet::BucketsForSize(size()); }
74
75 void SetOldGenerationPageFlags(MarkingMode marking_mode) {
76 return Chunk()->SetOldGenerationPageFlags(marking_mode, InSharedSpace());
77 }
78 void SetYoungGenerationPageFlags(MarkingMode marking_mode) {
79 return Chunk()->SetYoungGenerationPageFlags(marking_mode);
80 }
81
82 static inline void MoveExternalBackingStoreBytes(
83 ExternalBackingStoreType type, MutablePageMetadata* from,
84 MutablePageMetadata* to, size_t amount);
85
86 void DiscardUnusedMemory(Address addr, size_t size);
87
88 base::Mutex* mutex() const { return mutex_; }
89 base::SharedMutex* shared_mutex() const { return shared_mutex_; }
90
91 void set_concurrent_sweeping_state(ConcurrentSweepingState state) {
92 concurrent_sweeping_ = state;
93 }
94
95 ConcurrentSweepingState concurrent_sweeping_state() {
96 return static_cast<ConcurrentSweepingState>(concurrent_sweeping_.load());
97 }
98
99 bool SweepingDone() const {
100 return concurrent_sweeping_ == ConcurrentSweepingState::kDone;
101 }
102
103 template <RememberedSetType type, AccessMode access_mode = AccessMode::ATOMIC>
104 SlotSet* slot_set() {
105 if constexpr (access_mode == AccessMode::ATOMIC)
106 return base::AsAtomicPointer::Acquire_Load(&slot_set_[type]);
107 return slot_set_[type];
108 }
109
110 template <RememberedSetType type, AccessMode access_mode = AccessMode::ATOMIC>
111 const SlotSet* slot_set() const {
112 return const_cast<MutablePageMetadata*>(this)
113 ->slot_set<type, access_mode>();
114 }
115
116 template <RememberedSetType type, AccessMode access_mode = AccessMode::ATOMIC>
117 TypedSlotSet* typed_slot_set() {
118 if constexpr (access_mode == AccessMode::ATOMIC)
119 return base::AsAtomicPointer::Acquire_Load(&typed_slot_set_[type]);
120 return typed_slot_set_[type];
121 }
122
123 template <RememberedSetType type, AccessMode access_mode = AccessMode::ATOMIC>
124 const TypedSlotSet* typed_slot_set() const {
125 return const_cast<MutablePageMetadata*>(this)
126 ->typed_slot_set<type, access_mode>();
127 }
128
129 template <RememberedSetType type>
130 bool ContainsSlots() const {
131 return slot_set<type>() != nullptr || typed_slot_set<type>() != nullptr;
132 }
133 bool ContainsAnySlots() const;
134
135 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE SlotSet* AllocateSlotSet(RememberedSetType type);
136 // Not safe to be called concurrently.
137 void ReleaseSlotSet(RememberedSetType type);
138 TypedSlotSet* AllocateTypedSlotSet(RememberedSetType type);
139 // Not safe to be called concurrently.
140 void ReleaseTypedSlotSet(RememberedSetType type);
141
142 template <RememberedSetType type>
143 SlotSet* ExtractSlotSet() {
144 SlotSet* slot_set = slot_set_[type];
145 // Conditionally reset to nullptr (instead of e.g. using std::exchange) to
146 // avoid data races when transitioning from nullptr to nullptr.
147 if (slot_set) {
148 slot_set_[type] = nullptr;
149 }
150 return slot_set;
151 }
152
153 template <RememberedSetType type>
154 TypedSlotSet* ExtractTypedSlotSet() {
155 TypedSlotSet* typed_slot_set = typed_slot_set_[type];
156 // Conditionally reset to nullptr (instead of e.g. using std::exchange) to
157 // avoid data races when transitioning from nullptr to nullptr.
158 if (typed_slot_set) {
159 typed_slot_set_[type] = nullptr;
160 }
161 return typed_slot_set;
162 }
163
164 int ComputeFreeListsLength();
165
166 // Approximate amount of physical memory committed for this chunk.
167 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE size_t CommittedPhysicalMemory() const;
168
169 class ProgressBar& ProgressBar() { return progress_bar_; }
170 const class ProgressBar& ProgressBar() const { return progress_bar_; }
171
172 inline void IncrementExternalBackingStoreBytes(ExternalBackingStoreType type,
173 size_t amount);
174
175 inline void DecrementExternalBackingStoreBytes(ExternalBackingStoreType type,
176 size_t amount);
177
178 size_t ExternalBackingStoreBytes(ExternalBackingStoreType type) const {
179 return external_backing_store_bytes_[static_cast<int>(type)];
180 }
181
182 Space* owner() const {
183 return reinterpret_cast<Space*>(MemoryChunkMetadata::owner());
184 }
185
186 // Gets the chunk's allocation space, potentially dealing with a null owner_
187 // (like read-only chunks have).
188 inline AllocationSpace owner_identity() const;
189
190 static PageAllocator::Permission GetCodeModificationPermission() {
191 return v8_flags.jitless ? PageAllocator::kReadWrite
192 : PageAllocator::kReadWriteExecute;
193 }
194
195 heap::ListNode<MutablePageMetadata>& list_node() { return list_node_; }
196 const heap::ListNode<MutablePageMetadata>& list_node() const {
197 return list_node_;
198 }
199
200 PossiblyEmptyBuckets* possibly_empty_buckets() {
201 return &possibly_empty_buckets_;
202 }
203
204 // Release memory allocated by the chunk, except that which is needed by
205 // read-only space chunks.
206 void ReleaseAllocatedMemoryNeededForWritableChunk();
207
208 void IncreaseAllocatedLabSize(size_t bytes) { allocated_lab_size_ += bytes; }
209 void DecreaseAllocatedLabSize(size_t bytes) {
210 DCHECK_GE(allocated_lab_size_, bytes);
211 allocated_lab_size_ -= bytes;
212 }
213 size_t AllocatedLabSize() const { return allocated_lab_size_; }
214
215 void IncrementAgeInNewSpace() { age_in_new_space_++; }
216 void ResetAgeInNewSpace() { age_in_new_space_ = 0; }
217 size_t AgeInNewSpace() const { return age_in_new_space_; }
218
219 void ResetAllocationStatistics() {
220 MemoryChunkMetadata::ResetAllocationStatistics();
221 allocated_lab_size_ = 0;
222 }
223
224 MarkingBitmap* marking_bitmap() {
225 DCHECK(!Chunk()->InReadOnlySpace());
226 return &marking_bitmap_;
227 }
228
229 const MarkingBitmap* marking_bitmap() const {
230 DCHECK(!Chunk()->InReadOnlySpace());
231 return &marking_bitmap_;
232 }
233
234 size_t live_bytes() const {
235 return live_byte_count_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
236 }
237
238 void SetLiveBytes(size_t value) {
239 DCHECK_IMPLIES(V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS_8GB_BOOL,
240 ::IsAligned(value, kObjectAlignment8GbHeap));
241 live_byte_count_.store(value, std::memory_order_relaxed);
242 }
243
244 void IncrementLiveBytesAtomically(intptr_t diff) {
245 DCHECK_IMPLIES(V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS_8GB_BOOL,
246 ::IsAligned(diff, kObjectAlignment8GbHeap));
247 live_byte_count_.fetch_add(diff, std::memory_order_relaxed);
248 }
249
250 void ClearLiveness();
251
252 protected:
253 // Release all memory allocated by the chunk. Should be called when memory
254 // chunk is about to be freed.
255 void ReleaseAllAllocatedMemory();
256
257#ifdef DEBUG
258 static void ValidateOffsets(MutablePageMetadata* chunk);
259#endif
260
261 template <RememberedSetType type, AccessMode access_mode = AccessMode::ATOMIC>
262 void set_slot_set(SlotSet* slot_set) {
263 if (access_mode == AccessMode::ATOMIC) {
264 base::AsAtomicPointer::Release_Store(&slot_set_[type], slot_set);
265 return;
266 }
267 slot_set_[type] = slot_set;
268 }
269
270 template <RememberedSetType type, AccessMode access_mode = AccessMode::ATOMIC>
271 void set_typed_slot_set(TypedSlotSet* typed_slot_set) {
272 if (access_mode == AccessMode::ATOMIC) {
273 base::AsAtomicPointer::Release_Store(&typed_slot_set_[type],
274 typed_slot_set);
275 return;
276 }
277 typed_slot_set_[type] = typed_slot_set;
278 }
279
280 // A single slot set for small pages (of size kPageSize) or an array of slot
281 // set for large pages. In the latter case the number of entries in the array
282 // is ceil(size() / kPageSize).
283 SlotSet* slot_set_[NUMBER_OF_REMEMBERED_SET_TYPES] = {nullptr};
284 // A single slot set for small pages (of size kPageSize) or an array of slot
285 // set for large pages. In the latter case the number of entries in the array
286 // is ceil(size() / kPageSize).
287 TypedSlotSet* typed_slot_set_[NUMBER_OF_REMEMBERED_SET_TYPES] = {nullptr};
288
289 // Used by the marker to keep track of the scanning progress in large objects
290 // that have a progress bar and are scanned in increments.
291 class ProgressBar progress_bar_;
292
293 // Count of bytes marked black on page. With sticky mark-bits, the counter
294 // represents the size of the old objects allocated on the page. This is
295 // handy, since this counter is then used when starting sweeping to set the
296 // approximate allocated size on the space (before it gets refined due to
297 // right/left-trimming or slack tracking).
298 std::atomic<intptr_t> live_byte_count_{0};
299
300 base::Mutex* mutex_;
301 base::SharedMutex* shared_mutex_;
302 base::Mutex* page_protection_change_mutex_;
303
304 std::atomic<ConcurrentSweepingState> concurrent_sweeping_{
305 ConcurrentSweepingState::kDone};
306
307 // Tracks off-heap memory used by this memory chunk.
308 std::atomic<size_t> external_backing_store_bytes_[static_cast<int>(
309 ExternalBackingStoreType::kNumValues)] = {0};
310
311 heap::ListNode<MutablePageMetadata> list_node_;
312
313 FreeListCategory** categories_ = nullptr;
314
315 PossiblyEmptyBuckets possibly_empty_buckets_;
316
317 ActiveSystemPages* active_system_pages_;
318
319 // Counts overall allocated LAB size on the page since the last GC. Used
320 // only for new space pages.
321 size_t allocated_lab_size_ = 0;
322
323 // Counts the number of young gen GCs that a page survived in new space. This
324 // counter is reset to 0 whenever the page is empty.
325 size_t age_in_new_space_ = 0;
326
327 MarkingBitmap marking_bitmap_;
328
329 private:
330 friend class ConcurrentMarkingState;
331 friend class MarkingState;
332 friend class AtomicMarkingState;
333 friend class NonAtomicMarkingState;
334 friend class MemoryAllocator;
335 friend class MemoryChunkValidator;
336 friend class PagedSpace;
337 template <RememberedSetType>
338 friend class RememberedSet;
339 friend class YoungGenerationMarkingState;
340};
341
342} // namespace internal
343
344namespace base {
345// Define special hash function for chunk pointers, to be used with std data
346// structures, e.g. std::unordered_set<MutablePageMetadata*,
347// base::hash<MutablePageMetadata*>
348template <>
349struct hash<i::MutablePageMetadata*> : hash<i::MemoryChunkMetadata*> {};
350template <>
351struct hash<const i::MutablePageMetadata*>
352 : hash<const i::MemoryChunkMetadata*> {};
353} // namespace base
354
355} // namespace v8
